alert.note: Alert for Bastrop (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 31 at 2:16PM CST until January 31 at 8:30PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Bastrop. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 214 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bastrop, Camp Swift, Circle D-KC Estates, Paige, Wyldwood, Phelan, Bastrop State Park, Hills Prairie, Alum Creek, Buescher State Park, McDade, Watterson, Rockne, Red Rock and Bateman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
